perturbation.original_text:
This Outsourcing Agreement (hereinafter "Agreement") is effective as from the 1st day of January, 2009, by and between:

Parties to this agreement

SILICON SMELTERS << Pty >> Ltd, registration nr 1998/019036/07, VAT n° 4310178506, Registered office at Beyersnek Road, PO Box 657 Polokwane - South Africa, represented by Benoit Emile Norbert Ollivier, Managing Director, acting pursuant to the powers granted to him by the Board on the 22nd of May, 2008 (hereinafter referred to as "the Customer"),

AND

ESPACIO INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY, SA., a public limited company with place of business in P° de la Castellana, N° 259, 28046, Madrid, SPAIN, and represented by Mr. Carlos Lafitte as Chief Executive, in virtue of his powers, currently in force, conferred to him the 23rd of January of 1996 (Protocol No. 134), before Mr. Jose Maria Lucena Conde, Notary Public in Madrid, (hereinafter referred to as "EIT").   1
perturbation.changed_text:
This Outsourcing Agreement (hereinafter "Agreement") is effective as from the 1st day of January, 2009, by and between:

Parties to this agreement

SILICON SMELTERS << Pty >> Ltd, registration nr 1998/019036/07, VAT n° 4310178506, Registered office at Beyersnek Road, PO Box 657 Polokwane - South Africa, represented by Benoit Emile Norbert Ollivier, Managing Director, acting pursuant to the powers granted to him by the Board on the 22nd of May, 2008 (hereinafter referred to as "the Client"),

AND

ESPACIO INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY, SA., a public limited company with place of business in P° de la Castellana, N° 259, 28046, Madrid, SPAIN, and represented by Mr. Carlos Lafitte as Chief Executive, in virtue of his powers, currently in force, conferred to him the 23rd of January of 1996 (Protocol No. 134), before Mr. Jose Maria Lucena Conde, Notary Public in Madrid, (hereinafter referred to as "EIT").   1
perturbation.explanation: The term 'Customer' has been replaced with 'Client'. Later in the document both 'Customer' and 'Client' are used interchangeably. Since the contract defines SILICON SMELTERS initially as 'the Customer', the later use of 'Client' introduces ambiguity as to whether 'Client' refers to the same entity or a different one, creating uncertainty in enforcement.

perturbation.original_text: 2.4. The supervision of the Agreement is assured by EIT, represented by its Chief Executive, and by the Customer, represented by its Headof Information Technology Department.
perturbation.changed_text: 2.4. The supervision of the Agreement is assured by EIT, represented by its Chief Executive, and by the Client, represented by its Headof Information Technology Department.
perturbation.explanation: Section 2.4 uses 'Client' instead of 'Customer' to describe who is responsible for supervision, creating doubt of who is in charge to supervise the aggreement because the definition is not clear in previous statements.

perturbation.original_text: 3.1.1. The Customer has contracted, taking into account the technological standards defined by EIT, an external company (hereinafter "Network Supplier") for the setting up and the management of the Network. This Network Supplier is accountable to the Customer for the management of the Network.
perturbation.changed_text: 3.1.1. The Client has contracted, taking into account the technological standards defined by EIT, an external company (hereinafter "Network Provider") for the setting up and the management of the Network. This Network Supplier is accountable to the Customer for the management of the Network.
perturbation.explanation: This section uses 'Client' and 'Customer'. It also changes 'Network Supplier' to 'Network Provider' in the first sentence but still uses 'Network Supplier' in the second sentence. Now there is confusion between 'Network Provider' and 'Network Supplier' and what entity is responsible of the managemen of the network and who contracted to whom.
